title: Johnson & Johnson Opioid Verdict Overturned by Oklahoma Supreme Court
sub_head: Justices say district court stepped into shoes of legislature
body:
The Oklahoma Supreme Court overturned a ruling that held Johnson & Johnson liable for contributing to the state’s opioid-addiction crisis, the second court decision this month to favor drugmakers in opioid lawsuits.
In its ruling Tuesday, the state Supreme Court took issue with the lower court’s application of the state’s public-nuisance law, arguing it doesn’t cover the “manufacturing, marketing and the selling of prescription opioids.”
